intro: Kibara coriacea, commonly known as the rough kibara, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a fine, hairy texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Kibara coriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
